website_summaries.verdict: A Quad Core processor that delivers outstanding quality and is simple to install.
pros: Delivers up to 4.5 GHz turbo frequency
Can be overclocked up to 5 GHz
Provides support for up to 64 GB of DDR4-2400 RAM
Small chip is easy to install in minutes
Performs beautifully right out of the box
cons: Sometimes difficult to overclock the processor

website_summaries.verdict: Intel's "Kaby Lake" Core i7 flagship is speedy, with hardware support for 4K streaming and HDR for services like Netflix, but performance gains over its previous-generation counterpart are fairly minimal.
pros: Hardware support for HDR and 4K streaming
cons: Minimal speed upgrade over previous-generation flagship Core i7 chip

customer_reviews.title: A great CPU!
customer_reviews.text: Well CPU review so could go on forever but I won't, there are so many CPU's on the market at the minute It's hard to pick, I settled for this one to suit my setup and I wasn't disappointed, it will take anything you throw at it and more, temps are good while under load and It's easy to fit, absolutely no complaints from me. Does't come with a cooler so you will need to purchase this separately. Please take a second to hit the helpful button it makes taking the time to write the review worthwhile x.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Amazing CPU
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly straight out of the box. Extremely easy install. Great speeds for gaming and other tasks on a computer. Do not forget that this CPU does not come with a cpu cooler. I recommend the Corsair h100i pro or v2 model as this will cool it and give you good temperatures and optimum performance.
customer_reviews.author: The Tech Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Good CPU. I have only slightly overclocked it to 4.5Ghz to get my memory running at 4000Mhz. But boy did it make a difference. I would recommend it - idle temps are 30C and under load it gets to 60C (H100i V2 cooler) Only issue I have noticed is the temperatures tend to fluctuate quite a lot. For example when I am idle I will sometimes see the temp jump to 45-50C for a second then go back down without seeing the CPU usage increase accordingly. I have done some research and apparently it is nothing to worry about - a lot of users are experiencing the same spikes and intel don't deem it as an issue.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic delivery
customer_reviews.text: Delivery was beyond un-careful even damaging the item itself however after testing the item seems to work even with the damage without stuttering however it has only been tested for 10 mins. My other parts come later so I'm unable to test the product properly however since I only have ONE day to return it plus the long wait for the item there isn't much I can do. Pathetic. With a careful delivery of this product and a longer return policy this would be a 5 star review. P.s the damage is fron the cpu falling from it's plastic holding. You'd think for a massive company making sensitive components they'd take the obvious care needed.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Great processor - not much more to say!
customer_reviews.text: Really really like this processor - it was easy to install, easy to get up and running and now I've been using it for about a month in my new build, I've had no problems whatsoever - it runs anything I throw at it. I've not tried to overclock it but I'm sure it would do great in that scenario as well. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Arash Khosravi

customer_reviews.title: Nice fast performance
customer_reviews.text: Nice fast performance. This product does not come with a stock cooler, so you'll have to buy that separately. I installed this CPU along with 16GB (2 x 8GB) DDR4 3200 MHz CL14 RAM.
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Any computer person needs this speed in their life!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this as an upgrade to my computer as I stream online. There are more powerful options out there now but this is still holding up with the big dogs. I am still able to stream while playing games at a top quality for the stream and this CPU helps with that ten fold. On an i5 or i3 right now? Upgrade and you will LOVE the difference it makes to your computer life!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Fresle

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic processor. Been using it for 4 months now ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic processor. Been using it for 4 months now and I never see myself having issues running games, multiple applications or both. Don't think I will see myself reaching 100% CPU usage unless I've managed to mess something up somehow. Fast processor and probably a good pickup for anyone unwilling to dish out for an i9.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan A

customer_reviews.title: Powerful, future-proof PC tech
customer_reviews.text: For its price, it's worth every penny. This is a premium product that will deliver premium performance to your PC, whether you're just working, rendering videos, or gaming, of course! The compatibility with older motherboards (such as mine - an ASUS H110m-r) was what made this a perfect choice, and it was easy to install and worked instantly. Performance has been remarkable and this should last me some time.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Toworfe

customer_reviews.title: I7 7700k upgrade😁
customer_reviews.text: Not long installed this i7 7700k 4.2ghz 4 cores, and it runs beautifully, It's a major upgrade from my i5 650 3.2ghz 2cores, installation was simple and quick, I uaed a thermal compound called Arctic Silver 5 , I use this on all CPU's and GPU's. I'm Very happy with my new processor
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Extremely happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Extremely happy with this purchase, arrived exactly when advertised and performs better than i could have hoped for. I upgraded from a i5 2500k and the difference is huge. The K line of CPUs is normally for over clocking which I do not intend to do as the performance is more than adequate for the games I need to run at the moment. Mainly Battlefield 1 and Total war warhammer 2.
customer_reviews.author: SuperGingerRob

customer_reviews.title: Best gaming chip on the market at this moment in ...
customer_reviews.text: Best gaming chip on the market at this moment in time, but some chips are running hot as hell, just hope you get a good one, this one was fine but others restrict over-clocking so be aware, not all chips are created equal.
customer_reviews.author: True blue

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra cost over the competition
customer_reviews.text: Super fast and have it stable at 4800GHz although been higher and had it stable too. My first i7 and very happy I splashed out
customer_reviews.author: xinumoon

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: It works fine, if you want a full review I recommend researching comparisons with other processers to find the right one for you. This is excellent for high level gaming and can be overclocked to improve performance with a beefy cooler. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: B. Harris

customer_reviews.title: installed into z170 motherboard, worked no problems
customer_reviews.text: i installed this into a Z170 motherboard, but you might want to note i was upgrading from a skylake i5 cpu, which i used to update the bios before the I7 7700k even arrived, so if your buying a new board for this CPU buy a z270 or go straight to z370 and get an 8th gen CPU. that said, i installed the CPU, have it overclocked to 5Ghz and runs at around 75-80 degress C under full load. great CPU, worth the money, best upgrade ever
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Very good cpu
customer_reviews.text: Excellent CPU. Easy to install. My son is impressed. No issues with installtion and has been fine since installation. Decent price.

customer_reviews.title: Future proof for gaming
customer_reviews.text: I built my pc on Christmas 2017 This cpu has performed extremely well, coupled with my closed loop water cooling it sits at a stable 5.2ghz overclock. Will be future proof for years - highly recommended

customer_reviews.title: Still works, but it's feeling hot. If you ...

customer_reviews.title: Grate purchase
customer_reviews.text: item came wrapped up in multiple lairs of bubble wrap, so definitely happy with the care taken with the cpu with it not being in its original packaging. fit new cpu and it picked up strait away with no issues. have managed to carry out a safe overclocking and ran multiple stress test and found no lack of performance.

If you are not into gaming and need a computer for productivity I would suggest looking elsewhere. AMD's Ryzen offerings provide higher core count that can be utilised by editing and coding software.

customer_reviews.title: Best CPU I ever had what a MONSTER!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and correctly sealed in the box, I would recommend that if you have any air cooler like the 212 EVO do not go over 4.5 ghz, I tried with Prime95 with 100% load cpu was reaching around 87-90 celsius at 4.6ghz, I had to leave it back to stock at 4.2ghz with turbo boost to 4.5ghz and I managed to get max 80 celsius on 100%, This is the recommended temps: 80C Hot (100% Load) 75C Warm 70C Warm (Heavy Load) 60C Norm 50C Norm (Medium Load) 40C Norm 30C Cool (Idle) 25C Cool If you planning to overclock this over 4.5ghz use H110 or H115 and you should be good to go =D
customer_reviews.author: Cristiano

customer_reviews.title: would recommend.
customer_reviews.text: upgraded from a AMD FX 8350. I didn't realise how slow it was until i got this. would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey V

customer_reviews.title: I got lucky! Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.text: I heard people complaining about their 7700k has "overheating issues" but I haven't got a problem with mine. I use a Hyper 212 Evo and mine isn't entirely hot. It loads at 60°C and it's currently summer! The performance increase from my i7-870 was definitely a gigantic leap, even on stock. I can run my programs at its potential with this! I haven't overclocked mine properly yet but I got mine to 4.8 GHz using stock voltage. Wish you guys luck on your 7700k!
customer_reviews.author: Driftstein

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pricey for a processor but very fast and theoretically will last me years, so that's something

Also the prossesor was turn inside the box which made me think the product was previusly opend.. altho it sold as new. But it works fine so far.

customer_reviews.title: 8 ghz I could get it to 5 np but the now I'm happy with 4
customer_reviews.text: I run my CPU at 4.8 ghz I could get it to 5 np I'm happy with 4.8 and it runs cool too I'm using the h100i v2, under load battlefield etc it doesn't go beyond 55c I changed the stock paste on the h100i to as5 I usually use mx4 but this time I went with as5 cause it was on deliver for the next day I went with that instead so all good in the hood this cpu is very good for gaming and rendering etc cheers.

customer_reviews.title: Keep cool, my friend.
customer_reviews.text: The performance of this beast is already well known. This processor is also known for being quite hot, but I am getting good temperatures with a Dark Rock Pro 3. During P95 it didn't reach 80 degrees, but the room temperature was around 18. Hopefully I won't need to delid this beast.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel Gonçalves Machado

customer_reviews.title: Great IPC, disappointing improvement over Skylake
customer_reviews.text: The IPC improvements are the reason to buy a new processor, in my opinion. Otherwise, multithreaded workloads - whether games or editing - don't observe anywhere near the improvements on 4core CPUs to be worth the upgrade. Coming from Ivy Bridge, you do feel the difference on single core games like CS:GO or PUBG. It is worth the money in that context. But just be aware of what you're doing before you buy it. If you don't plan on streaming or editing, you really don't need anything more than an i5.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Dev

customer_reviews.title: Super fast but doesn't come with a cooler.
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? It's fast. I initially missed the fact that it doesn't come with a cooler and had to go out and buy one. The cooler I got is a Masterliquid 240 which does the job, but I would have preferred a Corsair. Unfortunately, I had all my PC parts on the table and was too excited about it to wait a couple more days for a delivery. Buy it with confidence, you won't regret it. It's built by a company that has a history of making reliable CPUs.
customer_reviews.author: George CP

customer_reviews.title: ... this does void your warranty in retrospect I am happy with the product just wish that the company that ...
customer_reviews.text: Yes if you've read their opinions this does have a overheating issue if you watch people on YouTube de lid their chip and that cools the chip down by a lot but this does void your warranty in retrospect I am happy with the product just wish that the company that made it didn't cheap out on thermal paste.
customer_reviews.author: mark crowther

customer_reviews.title: Decent cpu. Good for overclocking
customer_reviews.text: Very good cpu. Using my asus rog strix z270g motherboard which is great for being able to overclock my cpu. Ive been able to overclock this cpu to 4.8ghz which is stable and running at about 50 degrees Celsius. The only reason the temperature is higher than normal is that my thermal compound is not the best but would expect it to be in the low to mid 40's with some decent paste like artic silver. Would recommend to someone looking for a decent cpu with good overclockability.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Voce

customer_reviews.title: Runs Hot!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from an i7-6700 processor. Out of the box(With no speed or voltage overclock) has a thermal throttle issue where the CPU temp spikes from 39 to 75 degrees instantly and then rapidly onwards to 100 degrees and throttles down. Also noticed that during game play the frame rate varies much more and is generally lower on games which rely on some CPU processing. Seems to be a known issue and only solution is to delid the cpu and replace intel stock thermal paste with liquid metal. Waiting for my Thermal Grizzly Conductonaut which should hopefully resolve the issue or turn the processor into a expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great CPU but don't be surprised by how hot this ...
customer_reviews.text: Great CPU but don't be surprised by how hot this thing runs. Intel say anything below 100c is okay with the kaby lake version. I use kraken x62 and on full load this thing heats to 72c and when I OC to 4.8GHz it heats to 85c. You want to make sure your air flow is brilliant before installing this CPU.
customer_reviews.author: Thabo

customer_reviews.title: temp spikes now and again dont over do it on ...
customer_reviews.text: temp spikes now and again dont over do it on overclock i picked this over ryzen as i game most think i made the correct choice.

customer_reviews.title: Intel convert.
customer_reviews.text: Fast, fast,fast!!! upgraded my old PC from an old AMD setup to a new build with Intel and I am so pleased with the move. Mainly used my PC for CAD work so the way the processor handles the work is the priority. This had the best single core speeds and it is single core specs that matter when handling CAD designs as virtually all CAD software only utilise one core.
customer_reviews.author: GUT1967

customer_reviews.text: I bought this and then returned it. The i5-8400 is easily sufficient for gaming and returns similar performance at a much better price.

customer_reviews.author: Simon Buxton

customer_reviews.title: Meh, Intel aren't even trying any more.
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from a 3770k, minimal performance increase, runs quite hot (30c idle to 75c full load when watercooled with a H80i @ 4.5GHz). It's a flagship processor but unless you specifically need hyperthreading then don't bother and get an i5 instead. Gamers seem to buy these and I'm not sure why as HT won't improve your fps. I do some video editing, gaming, programming etc so although HT makes a difference, I can't really justify the extra cost.
customer_reviews.author: Benadryl Cucumbersnatch

customer_reviews.text: Best cpu I have had. Over locked to 4.75 GHz Stable with maximum temperature of 78C without water cooling.
customer_reviews.author: aldehid

customer_reviews.title: I am not going to complain too much as it seems to be fine after nearly a month
customer_reviews.text: The product heats up very quickly. I also noticed that the product was not brand new. I am not going to complaint too much as it seems to be fine after nearly a month, but i was slightly disappointed initially. I just hope that this is a genuine product.
customer_reviews.author: Chakia Blyth-Allen

customer_reviews.title: The mainstream choice for OC gaming CPU.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced a i7 4770k. Not tried over clocking it yet but idles about 30deg C. Under load goes 50-55 with a AIO cooler. Cooler than the old 4770k. Great for gaming and worth the extra money over the i5 in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: jayyay

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says on the tin, fast, reliable and overclockable
customer_reviews.author: Andy Myers

customer_reviews.text: This thing is an absolute monster of a CPU. Current benchmarks show that it is the absolute best CPU for gaming out of every single CPU on the market today.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

product_meta.title: Intel Core i7-7700K Desktop Processor 4 Cores up to 4.5 GHz Unlocked LGA 1151 100/200 Series 91W
product_meta.description: Style:Processor OnlyArchitected for performance, the Core i7-7700K processor packs 4 high-performing cores with core base frequency of 4.2GHz and 8MB of cache memory. Kick up the performance even higher with Intel Turbo Boost Technology 2.0 to bump the max turbo frequency to an amazing 4.5GHz. Add Intel Hyper-Threading Technology for 8-way multitasking to deliver the performance knockout punch. Not enough? For the enthusiast, this processor is unlocked, you can tweak the performance to its fullest potential.
